result.execSummary:
The defendant Bettie L McNeal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence Credit for 89 days granted.
Court deems TIME SERVED.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Court orders the following:
- 100 days jail.  Credit for 89 days.  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.
- Court costs waived
- DNA surcharge waived
- DNA sample waived
from Attorney Rosario objecting to State's request for adjournment.
from the State requesting an adjournment.
with attached witness list filed by State.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/businesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.
from the State explaining the Amended Information
Jury trial - 12 person on June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for receipt of doctor's report.  Both parties have received the report.  Defense does not challenge the findings.  Court finds defendant competent to proceed.  Court addresses the Amended Information filed by the State.  The Amended Information is correcting the aliases attributed to the defendant.  Court accepts the Amended Information.  Defense acknowledges receive of Amended Information.  Defense reqeusts this matter be set for trial.  Jury trial expected to last 1 day.  Court addresses bail.  Court orders cash bail reduced to $2,000.00.  All condtions to remain as previously set.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
by Dr. Rawski dated 5/5/15
Filed by the Defendant requesting a new attorney be appointed.
Hearing on May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is concerned that extradition would interfere with prosecuting this matter.  Defense requests a competency evaluation.  Court orders competency evaluation be completed and report filed within 15 days.  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
on defendant's Motion Requesting Modification of Bail
Hearing on April 22, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion to modify bail.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court denies defendant's motion to modify bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  State requests quick turn around date to check on status of extradition.  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 10:45 am.
WC inmate communication for received today, from the Defendant to Judge Foster.

filed by defendant requesting court date for a bail reduction.

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Lokken-Hopkins from the City of Brookfield was sworn and testified on behalf the state. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
